channel.title: python on James Arellano-Cortez

item.title: Python Post
item.description: #R library(reticulate) #Python #import pandas as pd #import seaborn as sns #df = sns.load_dataset('diamonds') #R #df1<-py$df #library(ggplot2) #ggplot()+geom_histogram(df1$carat,df1$price) #Python #import numpy as np #mat1=np.array([[1,2],[3,4]]) #R #mat2<-solve(py$mat1) #Python #np.dot(mat1, mat2).round() #I tried repeatedly to get these reticulated chunks to work together but coninued to get an error for each of the python chunks and the R chunks that used information from the python code chunks. I would like to demonstrate that I fully understand how reticulate allows us to switch back and forth between python and R using p$ and r.
